definitions.meaning: 递送或交付某物（如信件、包裹、货物等）
definitions.usage: 常用于描述将物品从一个地方送到另一个地方，通常涉及物理传递，常见于邮件、物流或服务场景。

examples.scene: 一个快递员在雨天骑着自行车，挨家挨户送信件，敲门后将包裹交给住户。
examples.chineseIdea: 快递员冒雨把包裹送到我家门口，敲门后递给我一个湿漉漉的箱子。
examples.sentenceWithBlank: The courier worked hard to @ @ @ despite the heavy rain.
examples.fullEnglishSentence: The courier worked hard to 「deliver a package」 despite the heavy rain.
examples.chineseTranslation: 快递员在大雨中努力「送包裹」给我。
examples.chinglishFix: 中式英语：'The courier send package to me in rain.' 纠正：'The courier delivered a package to me in the rain.'（避免用'send'，改为更自然的'deliver'并注意语法结构）

examples.scene: 邮递员每天清晨骑着邮车，穿过小镇，把信件塞进每个人的邮箱。
examples.chineseIdea: 邮递员每天早上都准时把信送到我们小镇的每个邮箱里。
examples.sentenceWithBlank: Every morning, the postman rides around to @ @ @ for the whole town.
examples.fullEnglishSentence: Every morning, the postman rides around to 「deliver mail」 for the whole town.
examples.chineseTranslation: 每天早上，邮递员骑车四处为整个小镇「送信」。
examples.chinglishFix: 中式英语：'Postman give mail to us every day.' 纠正：'The postman delivers mail to us every day.'（避免用'give'，搭配'deliver'更自然）

definitions.meaning: 发表或传递（演讲、承诺、结果等）
definitions.usage: 用于抽象场景，如演讲、承诺或结果的传递，常带有正式或郑重感，多用于口头表达或正式场合。

examples.scene: 一位政治家站在台上，对着数千名观众慷慨激昂地发表竞选演说。
examples.chineseIdea: 政治家在竞选时对着人群大声承诺要改变现状。
examples.sentenceWithBlank: The politician stood confidently to @ @ @ at the rally.
examples.fullEnglishSentence: The politician stood confidently to 「deliver a speech」 at the rally.
examples.chineseTranslation: 政治家在集会上自信地「发表演讲」。
examples.chinglishFix: 中式英语：'He say a speech to us.' 纠正：'He delivered a speech to us.'（避免用'say'，'deliver'更适合正式演讲）

examples.scene: 公司经理在年度会议上向团队展示过去一年的业绩，赢得掌声。
examples.chineseIdea: 经理向大家展示公司去年的成功，证明了自己的能力。
examples.sentenceWithBlank: The manager impressed everyone by @ @ @ at the meeting.
examples.fullEnglishSentence: The manager impressed everyone by 「delivering results」 at the meeting.
examples.chineseTranslation: 经理在会议上通过「交付成果」给所有人留下了深刻印象。
examples.chinglishFix: 中式英语：'Manager give us results.' 纠正：'The manager delivered results to us.'（'give'不够正式，'deliver'更贴切）

definitions.meaning: 实现或履行（期望、诺言等）
definitions.usage: 强调兑现承诺或达到预期，常用于描述某人或某物是否达到预期目标，具有结果导向的含义。

examples.scene: 一位创业者在朋友的资助下开了一家咖啡店，最终赚了钱还清了债务。
examples.chineseIdea: 他向朋友承诺会成功开店赚钱，最后真的做到了。
examples.sentenceWithBlank: He worked tirelessly to @ @ @ @ made to his investors.
examples.fullEnglishSentence: He worked tirelessly to 「deliver on a promise」 made to his investors.
examples.chineseTranslation: 他不懈努力，终于「兑现了对投资者的承诺」。
examples.chinglishFix: 中式英语：'He finish his promise.' 纠正：'He delivered on his promise.'（'finish'不恰当，'deliver on'更符合英语习惯）

examples.scene: 一家餐厅因食物美味、服务优秀而受到顾客的称赞，回头客越来越多。
examples.chineseIdea: 这家餐厅总是提供高质量的食物和服务，让顾客满意。
examples.sentenceWithBlank: The restaurant gained popularity by consistently @ @ @.
examples.fullEnglishSentence: The restaurant gained popularity by consistently 「delivering quality」.
examples.chineseTranslation: 这家餐厅因始终「提供品质」而受到欢迎。
examples.chinglishFix: 中式英语：'Restaurant give us good quality.' 纠正：'The restaurant delivers quality to us.'（'give'过于简单，'deliver'更强调持续性）
